Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that
believeth that Jesus is the Son of God." (I Jn. 5:5)

Our Lesson for Today:

Christ spoke strongly of the world hating Him. His kingdom
and the kingdom of this world are in hostility with one another...

John understood the lesson and summed it up in these words.
"We know that we are of God and the whole world lieth in wickedness."
"Love not the world, nor the things that are of the world."
"If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in Him."

The world still exerts a terrible influence over the Christian who does
not know that in Christ he has been crucified to the world. In the
pleasure in eating and drinking, in the love and enjoyment of what there
is to be seen of its glory, and in all that constitutes the pride of life. the
power of this world proves itself...

Most Christians are either utterly ignorant of the danger of a worldly
spirit or feel themselves utterly powerless to conquer it...

But Christ has left us a great promise: "Be of good cheer, I have overcome 
the world." So take the time to ask yourself whether you believe with your
whole heart in the victory that faith gives over the world...

Put your trust in the mighty power of God, in the abiding presence of Jesus 
as the only pledge of certain and continual victory...

Prayer Suggestion:
Pray for a life entirely possessed by the faith of Jesus to maintain
the victor's attitude at all times...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
On one occasion, while He was eating with them, He gave this
command: "Do not leave Jerusalem, but wait for the gift My
Father promised, which you have heard Me speak about...
For John baptized with water, but in a few days you will be
baptized with the Holy Spirit." (Acts 1:4-5)

After our Lord had given the command: "Go into all the world
and preach the Gospel to every creature," He again added
another, His very last command: "Wait till you receive the power
from above." "Wait for the promise of the Father." "You will
be baptized with the Holy Spirit."

All Christians agree that the great command to preach the Gospel 
to every creature was not only for the disciples but is binding on us
too...

But it seems that all do not appear to consider that the very last command,
not to preach until they had received the power from on high is equally
binding on us as it was on the disciples...

The Church appears to have lost possession of that which ought to be
to her a secret of secrets ~ the abiding consciousness, day by day, that 
it is only as she lives in the power of the Holy Spirit that she can preach the
Gospel in demonstration of the Spirit and of power...

So let us seek earnestly the grace of the Holy Spirit, who alone can Himself
reveal to us what eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, nor hath entered into
the heart of man to conceive ~ the things which God hath done and loves
to do for them that wait upon Him...

Prayer Suggestion:
Let us fervently pray for the power of the Holy Spirit.

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"God hath made that same Jesus, whom you have crucified,
both Lord and Christ." (Acts 2:36)

This our King is the crucified Jesus. God has place Him in
the midst of His throne as a lamb, as it has been slain, and 
so all the hosts of heaven adore Him ~ and so we worship
Him as a King...

has conquered every enemy and gained His place on the 
throne of God. AND it is this that He will impart to us too if

liveth in me," he taught us that it was the crucified One and
that Christ ruled on the throne of his heart and that the spirit 
of the cross would triumph over us as it did in Him...

So let us surrender our will, and the entire self-denial of our
old nature, so that we can become the worthy servants of a 
crucified King, and so that our hearts become worthy temples
of His glory...

Lord make me a worthy servant and my heart a
worthy temple of Your glory

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Being assembled with them, He charged them not to depart
from Jerusalem to wait for the promise of the Father." (Acts 1:4)

Our Lesson for Today:

If we would truly understand the outpouring of the Holy Spirit's answer
to the prayer of the disciples, we must ask: What was there in these men
that qualified them for such power, effectual prayer and the wonderful 
fulfillment of the promise that came to them???

Lets remember they were simple, unlearned men with many faults, but 
whom the Lord had called to forsake all and follow Him...

And oh yes we must also remember, They had done this, as far as they
could: they followed Him in the life He led and the work He did...

Oh yes like us there was much sin in them and they had as yet no power 
to fully deny themselves, but at the same time their hearts clung to Him 
in deep sincerity...

Even in the midst of much stumbling they still followed Him to the cross.
They shared with Him His death; unconsciously but most really, they died 
with Him to sin and were raised with Him in the power of new life...

Let this be the test by which we try ourselves whether we have indeed 
surrendered to the fellowship of Christ's suffering and death, and whether we 
have hated our old life and crucified it ~ and have received the power of
Christ's life in us...

Prayer Suggestion:
Lord make me a willing learner in the school of Jesus,
seeking above everything else that intimate fellowship
with Him...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

ever testifying of His wonderful love, of His power to redeem, of

the Church: so few who are willing in daily life to testify that Jesus
is Lord...

Lord teaches us one and all about the blessedness of so 
knowing Jesus and the power of His love, that we may find 
our highest joy in witnessing to what He is and has done in us...

Gospel ~ in everything a pastor is to be a witness for Jesus...

This gives us two truths. the first, that with all that the preacher teaches

that the teaching must always be a personal testimony from experience 
to what Christ is and can do...

It is precisely this that will build up believers so that they can walk in such
fellowship with Jesus Christ that He can reveal Himself through them...

Pray for such a sensitivity to the Holy Spirit's leading that
the abundance of the Spirit would go forth from your mouth 
praising and giving glory to our blessed Redeemer, Jesus 
Christ or Lord.

Today we are attacked on every side ~ Big business are folding up, 
there are influenza scares, tourist scares, contaminated food scares,
gun control scares, our retirements or savings will be lost, the list
goes on and on...

need more boldness. ~ Boldness is not reckless impulsiveness...

boldness, you can (1) pray for the power of the Holy Spirit to give you
courage, (2) look for opportunities in your family and neighborhood to 
talk about Christ, (3) realize that rejection, social discomfort, and 
embarrassment are not necessarily persecution, and (4) start where you 
are by being bolder in small ways...

Satin would have us to be all entangled with the things of the world, 
so that he can draw our attention away from the things of God...

Oh yes differences of opinion are inevitable among human personalities
and at times can actually be helpful if handled well. But spiritual unity is 
essential ~ loyalty, commitment, and love for God and His Word...

Without unity, the Christian Church as we know it will be over come and
we will go the way of Satin...

Lord Jesus, help us to become one again unified in the Word
give us boldness to share what You have done, and can do
for those who will believe...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"He that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is the mind of the Spirit,
because He maketh intercession for the saints according to the Will
of God." (Ro 8:27)

Our Lesson for Today:

What a light these words cast upon the life of prayer in the hearts
of Christians. We know not what we should pray for or as we ought...

How often this hinders our prayer or hinders the faith that is essential
to its success. But here for our encouragement we are told, that the 
Holy Spirit "maketh intercession" for us with groanings that cannot be 
uttered...

What a prospect is opened here for us! Where and how does the 
Spirit make intercession for the saints? 

In no other way than that, in the heart which knows not what to pray, He
secretly and effectually prays what is according to the Will of God...

This of course implies that we trust Him to do His work in us and that we
remain before God even when we know what to pray, in the assurance 
that the Holy Spirit is praying for us...

What a difference it would make in the life of many of God's saints if
they realized this!

Dear Heavenly Father, Help us to separate ourselves from the world.
Help us to yield ourselves wholeheartedly to the leading of the Spirit
within us, deepen all our thoughts or expectations. Help us to surrender
ourselves completely to You...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

"With all prayer and supplication, praying at all seasons in
the Spirit, and watching thereunto in all perseverance and
supplication for all the saints and on my behalf." (Eph, 6:18-17) R.V.

Our Lesson for Today:

I think that Paul had a deep sense of divine unity of the whole body of Christ
and of the actual need of unceasing prayer for all the members of the body
by all who belong to it...

AND He did not mean this to be an occasional thing, but the unceasing exercise
of a life long union in which we are bound together, should be evident from the words
he uses, "with all prayer and supplication, praying at all seasons in the spirit and 
watching thereunto, in all perseverance and supplication for all the saints."

He expects believers to be filled with the consciousness of the being in Christ
and through Him united consciously to the whole body, that in our daily life and
all its engagements, our highest aim would always be the welfare of the body of
Christ of which we are members...

So as children of God let us live for Christ our King...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to live in a willingness of sacrifice of 
prayer and intercession at all times and for all saints! Amen.

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"Continue in prayer. and watch in the same with thanksgiving,
withal praying also for us." (Col. 4:2-3)

Our lesson for Today:

Prayer for all saints: let this be our first thought. It will need time
and thought and love to realize what is included in that simple
expression...

Think of your own neighborhood and all the saints you know; think
of our whole country and praise God for all who are His saints;
think of all Christian nations of the world and the saints to be found
in each of these;

think of all the heathen nations and the saints of God to be found
among them in ever-increasing numbers.

Think of all the different circumstances and conditions in which
these are to be found and all the varying needs which call for God's 
grace and help.

Think of the many, oh, so many, who are God's saints and yet through
ignorance or sloth, through worldly-mindedness or an evil heart of
unbelief are walking in the dark and bringing no honor to God.

Think of so many who are in earnest and yet conscious of a life of failure,
with little or no power to please God or to bless man. And then think again 
of those who are found everywhere, in solitary places or in companies,
whose one aim is to serve the Lord who bought them to be the light of 
those around them...

This is not the work of one day or one night. It needs a heart which will
set itself from time to time to do serious thinking in regard to the state
and the need of the body of Christ to which we all belong...

Prayer Suggestion:
Pray daily for the love of God and Christ to fill our hearts ~ and ~
for the power of the Holy Spirit to come down and accomplish
His work in this sinful world...

06/01/09~~~food for Thought~~~Let us discontinue selfish prayers...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Give us day by day our daily bread." (Lk. 11:3)

Our Lesson for Today:

There are many Christians who are afraid of the thoughts of a promise
to pray every day as being far beyond their capability...

They feel that they could not uphold this promise ~ but yet they pray to
God to give them their bread day by day. If the children of God once
yielded themselves with their whole lives to God's love and service, they
should count it a privilege to avail themselves of any invitation that would
help them every day to come into God's Presence with the great need
of His Church and Kingdom...

Are there not many who confess that they desire to live wholly for God?

Are there not many who acknowledge that Christ gave Himself for them?

Are there not many who say that In His love He watches over them and
works in them without ceasing?

And aren't there many that admit that nothing less than the measure of the 
love of Christ to us should be the measure of our love to Him?

Don't they also feel that this ought to be the standard of their life?

If this be true, shouldn't they welcome every opportunity for proving day by 
day that they are devoting their heart's strength to the interest of Christ's
Kingdom and to the prayer that can bring down God's blessing?

To those who have to confess that they have not totally understood the high 
privilege and the solemn duty of waiting on God in prayer for His blessing
on the world should now welcome the invitation...

Prayer Suggestion:
Enlarge my vision to include daily united prayer for
all of Your children and all the work of Your Kingdom...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"They were all with one accord in one place...and they
were all filled with the Holy Spirit." (Acts 2:1, 4)

Our Lesson for Today:

Our last chapters opened up to us wonderful thoughts of
the solidarity of the whole body of Christ and the need to
cultivate the slumbering or buried talents of intercession...

We need to thank God, for we know of the tens of thousands
of His children who in daily prayer are pleading for some portion 
of the work of God's kingdom in which they are personally 
interested...

But in many cases there is a lack of that large-hearted and
universal love that takes up all the saints of God and their service
into His embrace. There is not the boldness and the strength
that comes from the consciousness of being part of a large
and conquering army under the leadership of our conquering
King...

The thought to remember is: The power of each individual member
is increased to a large degree by the inspiration of fellowship with a
large and conquering host...

Nothing can help us to an ever-larger faith as the consciousness of 
being one body and one spirit in Christ Jesus...

Prayer Suggestion:
Let us pray that we would always be mindful that
united prayer brings the answer to prayer.
